name: internalized
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal (of an idea, opinion, belief, feeling, etc.) accepted or absorbed so that it becomes part of your character: Morality comes from the internalized standards that allow people to live harmoniously in groups. All these women had an internalized sense of shame. Synonym
interiorized formal
More examplesFewer examplesThen, whenever we find ourselves faced with uncertainty or difficulty, we call on that internalized image.She believes that political correctness has become an internalized belief system for many Americans.Their religious lives combined an internalized and private spirituality with the warmth and conviviality of good fellowship.
